results.title: World Cup athletics
results.creator_credit: Tony Maylam and International Amateur Athletic Federation
results.brief_description: In September 1977 at Dusseldorf, Germany, a great new world sports series began. Eight teams of top athletes from all continents met to compete for the first ever World Cup of Track and Field Athletics. The film captures some of the most vivid moments and lasting impressions of a unique event, the I.A.A.F. World Cup.

results.title: World Class De-Forestation
results.creator_credit: Campbell Manderson, Pip Starr and SKA TV
results.brief_description: A look at the damaging effects of the de-forestation occurring in the East Gippsland forest ranges and the efforts of a group of activists to stop it. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: World beaters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TV Eye”.
This film looks behind the headlines of Japan’s economic miracle to the personal attitudes that make it possible. Also looks at the problems which lie ahead for Japan and the Japanese as the need to keep improving industrial performance puts pressure on the traditional concept of lifetime job security.

results.title: World bank
results.creator_credit: James Lipscomb and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: How the World bank plays a major role in helping countries to modernise is dramatised in this film. An official of the bank makes a trip to a country to make certain that the request for a $21 million loan to build a highway will indeed help to develop the area and really benefit the people of the country.

results.title: World at your feet
results.creator_credit: Larry Gosnell, Michael Spencer and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Man’s inevitable and invaluable associate, the soil, is shown in a new light, a veritable thriving community in miniature, populated by living things of the animal, plant and insect worlds, some draining the soil of its usefulness, others contributing to its productivity. How this soil world maintains a harmonious balance is shown in highly magnified sequences employing time-lapse photography and photomicrography. The film deals extensively with soil substance, analysing different types of soil structure and their resistance to varying natural conditions. Suggestions are made as to how man can make his own contributions to the good of the earth.

results.title: World around us: chain of life
results.brief_description: Illustrates nature’s methods of making food chains which tie together all the living creature in a community, making one dependent on the others for its existence. The film includes close-ups of tadpoles eating algae, crayfish catching and eating tadpoles, links in the food chain through green bass, fish eggs, a Polythemus moth is hatched from its cocoon and a spider builds its web - to trap some other creatures and complete the “chain of life”.

results.title: World's toughest car trial
results.brief_description:
A film record of the 1953 Redex Car Trial. The film begins with the scrutineering of the cars in Sydney, their start on the official route,
following them through many of the controls and finally concluding with their return to Sydney and the presentation of prizes to winners.

results.title: Workshop for peace. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh, Ramakantha Sarma and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: A tour of the United Nations building in New York, and an explanation of the function of the United Nations Organisation, the Secretariat, councils and agencies. Shows the unique architecture of the building and the vaious meeting halls. Narrated by John Grueh. Music by Ben Park.
